label.label: Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE)
label.reasoning: National honor recognizing distinguished contributions to the arts and sciences, or significant achievements in public life.

supporting_quotes: She was appointed Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) in 2025 for services to drama.
Carey Mulligan at Sundance in 2025
events.notes: Honorific appointment with no ongoing responsibilities.

quotes:
2.1
2004–2008: Early work

2.2
2009–2014: Breakthrough and rise to prominence

2.3
2015–2019: Critical acclaim

2.4
2020–present: Established actress
Mulligan made her professional acting debut on stage in Kevin Elyot's play Forty Winks (2004) at the Royal Court Theatre.

She made her film debut with a supporting role in Joe Wright's romantic drama Pride & Prejudice (2005), followed by diverse roles in television, including the drama series Bleak House (2005), and the television film Northanger Abbey (2007).

She made her film debut with a supporting role in Joe Wright's romantic drama Pride & Prejudice (2005), followed by diverse roles in television, including the drama series Bleak House (2005), and the television film Northanger Abbey (2007).
She made her Broadway debut playing Nina in the revival of Anton Chekhov's The Seagull (2008).

Mulligan's breakthrough role came as a 1960s schoolgirl in the coming-of-age film An Education (2009), for which she won the BAFTA Award for Best Actress and received a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress.
Carey Mulligan at Sundance in 2025
She was appointed Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) in 2025 for services to drama.
Carey Hannah Mulligan (born 28 May 1985) is a British actress.

label.label: Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Actress

supporting_quotes: For her performance, she received her second nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress and won the Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Actress, among many other accolades.
events.notes: Clear award recognition for Best Actress.

quotes: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the film's release was delayed to 25 December 2020.
In 2021, Mulligan replaced Nicole Kidman in The Dig, a film about the events of the 1939 excavation of Sutton Hoo, co-starring Ralph Fiennes and Lily James.
Mulligan's sole release of 2022 was She Said, based on the non-fiction book of the same name.
Mulligan then starred as Felicia Montealegre in Bradley Cooper's directorial Maestro (2023), a biopic about the relationship between Montealegre and her husband Leonard Bernstein (played by Cooper).

quotes: She portrayed Megan Twohey, one of the real-life New York Times reporters who broke the Harvey Weinstein scandal.

quotes: She also played a small part in Fennell's second feature Saltburn, for which she was deemed a 'scene-stealer' by Variety.

organizations.name: Berlin International Film Festival
quotes: The film had its world premiere at the 74th Berlin International Film Festival, and received mostly mixed reviews.

roles.title: writer-director
quotes: as 90%, with a critics consensus reading, 'A boldly provocative, timely thriller, Promising Young Woman is an auspicious feature debut for writer-director Emerald Fennell — and a career highlight for Carey Mulligan.'

roles.title: Best Actress
quotes: For her performance, she received her second nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress and won the Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Actress, among many other accolades.

quotes: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the film's release was delayed to 25 December 2020.

Mulligan's sole release of 2022 was She Said, based on the non-fiction book of the same name.
Mulligan then starred as Felicia Montealegre in Bradley Cooper's directorial Maestro (2023), a biopic about the relationship between Montealegre and her husband Leonard Bernstein (played by Cooper).
